SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.attachments.v2.ui.managed
Class AttachmentViewModel

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.attachments.v2.ui.managed.AttachmentViewModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, AttachmentModel
public class AttachmentViewModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements AttachmentModel, java.io.Serializable

The implementation of the in-memory attachments model. It is responsible for storing information such as the selected row keys, categories, etc. It is also responsible for ensuring that the actual model is updated for DML events suc as add/delete.

Since:
11.1.1.7.4
Version:
$Header: atgpf/applcore/applications/UIComponents/ViewController/src/oracle/apps/fnd/applcore/attachments/v2/ui/managed/AttachmentViewModel.java /st_atgpf_11.1.1.7.4/9 2014/11/10 14:03:00 nlo Exp $

AttachmentViewModel

                           java.lang.Boolean orderingEnabled,
                           java.lang.Boolean componentReadOnly,
                           java.lang.Boolean updateAllowed)
Default Constructor.

Parameters:
propertyMap - The map of all Attachment Component properties to their ValueExpression.
actionEntity - The actionEntity from the component.
updateCategoryList - The updateCategoryList from the component.
typesEnabled - The attachment types which are enabled for this component.
repositoryMode - Whether repository mode is enabled.
orderingEnabled - Whether ordering enabled is set on the component.
componentReadOnly - Whether the read only flag has been set on the component.
updateAllowed - Whether the component has been set to allow updates.

getAttachmentRows

public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Object,AttachmentsVORowImpl> getAttachmentRows(java.util.List<java.io.Serializable> rowKeys)
Retreive the collection of attachment rows based upon the keys provided.

Parameters:
rowKeys - the list of row keys. If null then all rows will be returned.
Returns:
a map between the keys provided and their associated rows. An empty collection if there was an error whislt processing.

Returns:
a map between the keys provided and their associated rows. An empty collection if there was an error whislt processing.

processAddAttachment

public java.lang.String[] processAddAttachment()
Add an attachment to the bindings AttachmentModel. The data for this attachment is already in the AddAttachmentModel instance.

null if successful, otherwise an collection of error messages stating what add issue was.

processAddFileAttachment

public java.lang.String[] processAddFileAttachment(java.util.List<org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.UploadedFile> fileList)
Add the list of files as attachments to the attachment model. The information for the other fields will come from the AddAttachmentsModel.

Parameters:
fileList - the list of uploaded files to add as attachments.
Returns:
null if successful, otherwise an collection of error messages stating what add issue was.

updateAttachment

public java.lang.String[] updateAttachment(org.apache.myfaces.trinidad.model.UploadedFile file,
                                           oracle.jbo.Row uplRow,
                                           boolean restoreCheckoutState)
Upload the file to the attachment model for the row supplied. If no row is provided then the display row will be used. The information for the other fields will come from the AddAttachmentsModel.

Parameters:
file - the file to upload to the attachment display row.
restoreCheckoutState - if set then the attachment was checked out before the update then it will remain checked out after. if not set then the check in will always be not checked out.
Returns:
null if successful, otherwise an collection of error messages stating what add issue was.

processAddContentServerItemAttachment

public java.lang.String[] processAddContentServerItemAttachment(oracle.webcenter.content.JCRContentID[] contentIds)
Internal Use, method provided for continuity of service while replacement capability is being developed. This method will be removed. Add the list of Content Ids as attachments to the attachment model. The information for the other fields will come from the AddAttachmentsModel.

Parameters:
contentIds - the list of uploaded files to add as attachments.
Returns:
null if successful, otherwise an collection of error messages stating what add issue was.

getTextContents

public void getTextContents()
Issue the request for the display row to be retreived from the WCC/UCM server into the uploadedText attribute.

isFileUpdateAllowed

public boolean isFileUpdateAllowed()
Determine if a file Update should be allowed. Based upon the DataType of the attachment, whether the row is readonly and if there are any errors will influence this decision.

Specified by:
isFileUpdateAllowed in interface AttachmentModel
Returns:
true if the file Update button should be shown.
